text: Hi all - is there any way to avoid the broken formatting in the drag and drop editor when using conditional formatting in modules? It shows up fine when previewing and sending for a specific contact, but not in the editor. This will be a pain for our designers maintaining these templates.
Also, does anyone know why this is showing when I try to add module input fields?

I would disagree a little. Newsletter style (though depends on what your definition of this is) is definitely possible with Gmail. Of course not crazy long because eventually you will hit the 102kb limit but that limit is due to the amount of code.

The drag and drop editor adds a LOT of unnecessary code bloat, this is the same for many other platform’s editors as well. And something like 2 columns is going to add even more code.

We would sometimes run in this issue with the drag and drop editor for one of our weekly emails (HubSpot’s little pop up about it would appear), but once I custom coded a template, where I have complete control over the code output, it's never been an issue.
The work-around is to use contact_without_defaults instead of just contact.
